page.title: 01Flotta
page.content: Flotta is an island at the south end of Scapa Flow. It is horse shoe shaped being about 4 kilometres wide 2 long. The northern peninsula of flotta is dominated by the Flotta Oil Terminal. Oil is piped here from the piper and claymore oil fields in the north sea. The vol.latile gases are taken off and the oil is shipped out by tanker. the remainder of the island is intensivery farmed grassland. Though the western end of Flotta is mainly rough pasture and moor land. This area of the survey covers the eastern side of flotta. The N peninsla, Pan Hope Bay and the southern peninsula where most of the population of Flotta Live.
